lines.text: God help him, he made a mistake.

[Opening lines]
Gentlemen, this is a corpse!

[to the interns in the operating theater]
I have been a pathologist for over 25 years. I haven't gotten a single laugh out of it yet.

[to Lucas]
Sometimes I wish I had 75 more pounds. I'd belt you one!

[Saying farewell to his graduating interns]
Good-bye and God bless all of you... and don't endorse any cigarettes!

I can see the picture you got of yourself already... a country road and an old Ford. It's a white house and you are Saint George complete in spotless armor. You get to a farmhouse. There's this man bleeding to death. Now alone, without instruments, without assistance, you perform an impossible operation, and because your heart is pure, you save him.

[Interrupting]
You're going to go down that road. When you get there, you know what you're going to find? A man with a boil on his backside. You hear me? A boil on his backside! You will lance it and go home.

[Smiling ironically and turning to leave]
Good-bye, Doctor.

[Loudly across the room]
Marsh, you're one of the most brilliant students we've ever had here. You'll be aa great physician. Stop living your life like a Greek tragedy, or you'll muff it!

[Meeting Al for the first time]
I was told you'd have a Cadillac.

[Wryly]
It's just a front. The Cadillac has me.
